lead_paragraph: Use your imagination to write the opening of a short story or poem inspired by this illustration — or, tell us about a memory from your own life that this image makes you think of.

abstract: Our columnist answers questions about the troubles in the bond market, and what they mean for investors.
snippet: Our columnist answers questions about the troubles in the bond market, and what they mean for investors.
lead_paragraph: It’s been a horrible start of the year for the bond market, the worst in decades.

abstract: Do you see walking as an enjoyable activity, or is it just a way to get from one place to another?
snippet: Do you see walking as an enjoyable activity, or is it just a way to get from one place to another?
lead_paragraph: Do you enjoy walking around your neighborhood? Have you ever discovered something interesting or surprising near where you live when walking around? During the pandemic, Mary Hosbrough and Jennifer Jacobsen-Wood tried something new: They met up daily to walk every street of their hometown, Peoria, Ill.

abstract: How the company got mired in a moral panic.
snippet: How the company got mired in a moral panic.
lead_paragraph: I don’t know Latoya Raveneau, but I feel terrible for her. An executive producer at Disney, she was a speaker at a recent virtual all-hands company meeting about Florida’s “Don’t Say Gay” bill. Inside Disney, there had been considerable anger that the company, one of the state’s largest employers, had donated to politicians behind the bill and hadn’t done more to fight it. Raveneau stepped up to defend the company’s queer friendliness, only to become a national object of right-wing fury and disgust.

abstract: At 26, Sammy Basso is believed to be the oldest person with the disease Progeria. And now he’s researching it, hoping to find a treatment and the secrets of aging.
snippet: At 26, Sammy Basso is believed to be the oldest person with the disease Progeria. And now he’s researching it, hoping to find a treatment and the secrets of aging.
lead_paragraph: TEZZE SUL BRENTA, Italy — Like many an Italian man living at home in his mid-20s, Sammy Basso is a little embarrassed by the childhood mementos that clutter his small bedroom.

abstract: In seeking to discredit her, they have concocted a scary version of a Black woman  to serve up to their base.
snippet: In seeking to discredit her, they have concocted a scary version of a Black woman  to serve up to their base.
lead_paragraph: When Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson’s Supreme Court nomination reaches the Senate floor soon, every Republican who votes against her confirmation will be complicit in the abuse that the Republican members of the Judiciary Committee heaped on her.

abstract: The U.S. economy added 431,000 jobs and the unemployment rate fell to 3.6 percent. Wages showed sharp gains, but that has been blunted by inflation.
snippet: The U.S. economy added 431,000 jobs and the unemployment rate fell to 3.6 percent. Wages showed sharp gains, but that has been blunted by inflation.
lead_paragraph: A continued torrent of consumer demand, paired with a decline in coronavirus caseloads and health restrictions, led to a burst of job creation last month, showing the staying power of the economic recovery.

abstract: States pushed back on a plan to take back some of their stimulus money to fund President Biden’s emergency spending request. Now Congress is trying to find other ways to offset the cost.
snippet: States pushed back on a plan to take back some of their stimulus money to fund President Biden’s emergency spending request. Now Congress is trying to find other ways to offset the cost.
lead_paragraph: FRANKFORT, Ky. — Gov. Andy Beshear has been toting oversize checks around his state in recent weeks, handing them out to city and county officials for desperately needed water improvements.

abstract: Vladimir Putin made a threat of nuclear weapons. The U.S. and NATO should be less deferential.
snippet: Vladimir Putin made a threat of nuclear weapons. The U.S. and NATO should be less deferential.
lead_paragraph: The Biden administration has done an admirable job checking Russian disinformation efforts by disclosing U.S. intelligence assessments of Moscow’s intentions and marshaling unified political support for Ukrainian sovereignty and indirect military support for its defense.

byline.original: By Steven Simon and Jonathan Stevenson

abstract: The historian Nicholas Mulder on how the West’s sanctions can help end Putin’s war — or escalate it.
snippet: The historian Nicholas Mulder on how the West’s sanctions can help end Putin’s war — or escalate it.
lead_paragraph: The Russian political scientist Ilya Matveev recently described the impact of the West’s sanctions on his country as “30 years of economic development thrown into the bin.” He’s not exaggerating. Economists expect the Russian economy to contract by at least 15 percent of G.D.P. this year. Inflation is spiking. An exodus of Russian professionals is underway. Stories of shortages and long lines for basic consumer goods abound.

abstract: Democrats and Republicans alike stuffed nearly 5,000 earmarks totaling $9 billion into the $1.5 trillion government spending bill signed by President Biden.
snippet: Democrats and Republicans alike stuffed nearly 5,000 earmarks totaling $9 billion into the $1.5 trillion government spending bill signed by President Biden.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — One hundred million dollars for an airport in Mobile, Ala. Tens of thousands for upgrades to a police station in the tiny town of Milton, W.Va. Hundreds of thousands of dollars sent to Arkansas to deal with feral swine.

byline.original: By Luke Broadwater, Emily Cochrane and Alicia Parlapiano

abstract: Under Coach Jay Wright, the Wildcats have made four Final Fours and won two national titles, all without any one-and-done players.
snippet: Under Coach Jay Wright, the Wildcats have made four Final Fours and won two national titles, all without any one-and-done players.
lead_paragraph: Update: Kansas beat UNC to win the NCAA Championship.

abstract: Create a one-page field note that explores the meaning and usage of one of our Words of the Day. Submissions are due on April 29.
snippet: Create a one-page field note that explores the meaning and usage of one of our Words of the Day. Submissions are due on April 29.
lead_paragraph: Naturalists often record their discoveries about nature in field notes. A field note about fire ants might catalog where they are found, what they look like, how common they are and how they interact with other animals.

abstract: Vladyslav Heraskevych, a skeleton competitor from Ukraine, gathers supplies and uses the team van to deliver them to Kyiv as he waits to be called for military duty.
snippet: Vladyslav Heraskevych, a skeleton competitor from Ukraine, gathers supplies and uses the team van to deliver them to Kyiv as he waits to be called for military duty.
lead_paragraph: A little more than a month has passed since the end of the Beijing Olympics, but already the Games, like the ones before, have distilled into a handful of images and moments.

abstract: A major restoration project aims to protect the Jamaica Bay area — and all of New York — by returning salt marshes and sand dunes to their natural states. But will it be too late for the people of Broad Channel?
snippet: A major restoration project aims to protect the Jamaica Bay area — and all of New York — by returning salt marshes and sand dunes to their natural states. But will it be too late for the people of Broad Channel?
lead_paragraph: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

abstract: After struggling for more than a year, the former world No. 1 has advanced to her first women’s singles final since she won the Australian Open in 2021.
snippet: After struggling for more than a year, the former world No. 1 has advanced to her first women’s singles final since she won the Australian Open in 2021.
lead_paragraph: MIAMI GARDENS, Fla.— Thirteen months.

abstract: Lawyers made closing arguments on Friday in the federal trial involving four men with militia ties who are accused of conspiring to kidnap Gov. Gretchen Whitmer.
snippet: Lawyers made closing arguments on Friday in the federal trial involving four men with militia ties who are accused of conspiring to kidnap Gov. Gretchen Whitmer.
lead_paragraph: GRAND RAPIDS, Mich. — The government’s accusations were jarring: Several men with militia ties had schemed to abduct Gov. Gretchen Whitmer of Michigan at her vacation home. The group, prosecutors and witnesses said, had held a series of “field training exercises” and discussed killing or stranding her in a boat in the middle of Lake Michigan.

abstract: In Costa Rica’s runoff on Sunday, voters will decide between a candidate found to have sexually harassed junior employees at the World Bank and a former president once accused of corruption.
snippet: In Costa Rica’s runoff on Sunday, voters will decide between a candidate found to have sexually harassed junior employees at the World Bank and a former president once accused of corruption.
lead_paragraph: SAN JOSÉ, Costa Rica — He was demoted from a senior position at the World Bank because of sexual harassment. Now, the economist Rodrigo Chaves — who has campaigned as a populist outsider in an election marked by anger at traditional politicians — leads the polls to become Costa Rica’s next president on Sunday.

byline.original: By David Bolaños and Anatoly Kurmanaev

abstract: Democrats have long held up Nevada as a symbol of their future. But as the state’s economy struggles, it has become the epitome of the party’s midterm difficulties.
snippet: Democrats have long held up Nevada as a symbol of their future. But as the state’s economy struggles, it has become the epitome of the party’s midterm difficulties.
lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS — Scars from the coronavirus pandemic are still visible here. Housing prices skyrocketed, with rents rising faster than almost anywhere else in the country. Roughly 10,000 casino workers remain out of work. Gas prices, now more than $5 a gallon, are higher than in every other state except California.

byline.original: By Jennifer Medina and Reid J. Epstein

abstract: Federal Reserve officials are tasked with fostering “full employment.” At least for now, some see the labor market as uncomfortably tight.
snippet: Federal Reserve officials are tasked with fostering “full employment.” At least for now, some see the labor market as uncomfortably tight.
lead_paragraph: Federal Reserve officials are tasked with fostering “full employment,” and while it has been difficult to guess what that means as the economy recovers from huge job losses at the start of the pandemic, March hiring data seemed likely to reaffirm to policymakers that the labor market is running hot.

abstract: When parents go their separate ways in a divorce, children are torn between two places — both should feel like home.
snippet: When parents go their separate ways in a divorce, children are torn between two places — both should feel like home.
lead_paragraph: The day my ex and I had to tell our children that we were getting divorced, we sat on the couch in the living room as they played on the rug below us. It was a pivotal moment, and our almost 5-year-old, Isaac, sensing that something big and disruptive was happening, had one very important question: What would happen to his Legos?

abstract: The Times’s Visual Investigations team shares the rigorous process of confirming (or disputing) the authenticity of videos about the war in Ukraine.
snippet: The Times’s Visual Investigations team shares the rigorous process of confirming (or disputing) the authenticity of videos about the war in Ukraine.
lead_paragraph: A brief, shaky video uploaded to Telegram on March 17 showed bodies on the ground in Mariupol, one of Ukraine’s largest cities, which has been battered by Russian military attacks in the continuing war. The person behind the camera shouted that it was March 13. But could the date — and the content itself — be corroborated?

abstract: Rising costs at the pump, war in Ukraine, an emboldened fossil fuel industry and stalled legislation have imperiled President Biden’s climate agenda.
snippet: Rising costs at the pump, war in Ukraine, an emboldened fossil fuel industry and stalled legislation have imperiled President Biden’s climate agenda.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A year after he entered the White House with a vow that fighting global warming would be a driving priority for his administration, President Biden finds his climate agenda is mired in delay and faces legal, legislative and political headwinds that could diminish or dismantle it entirely.

abstract: As pandemic restrictions lifted, the travel industry was looking forward to a strong summer season. But they may be disappointed.
snippet: As pandemic restrictions lifted, the travel industry was looking forward to a strong summer season. But they may be disappointed.
lead_paragraph: Diego Sanz, a tour guide on Spain’s southeastern Mediterranean coast, received his first international group booking in more than a year in mid February. It was, he thought, an augury of better things to come.

abstract: New Yorkers still tell stories of browsing at Harlem’s Liberation Bookstore or spending the afternoon at Scribner’s.
snippet: New Yorkers still tell stories of browsing at Harlem’s Liberation Bookstore or spending the afternoon at Scribner’s.
lead_paragraph: New York City is home to wonderful bookstores, but there used to be so many more of them to choose from — from Coliseum Books, just south of Columbus Circle; to Ivy’s Curiosities and Murder Ink on the Upper West Side; to the dearly departed St. Mark’s Bookshop in the East Village. By one count, there were 386 booksellers in Manhattan in 1950, including almost 40 on a six-block stretch of Fourth Avenue. (By comparison, there are fewer than 100 in the city now.) Here’s a look back at a few old favorites.

byline.original: By Tina Jordan and Erica Ackerberg

abstract: Five articles from around The Times, narrated just for you.
snippet: Five articles from around The Times, narrated just for you.
lead_paragraph: This weekend, listen to a collection of narrated articles from around The New York Times, read aloud by the reporters who wrote them.

abstract: Russian soldiers left the decommissioned nuclear plant and a nearby city after five weeks of occupation.
snippet: Russian soldiers left the decommissioned nuclear plant and a nearby city after five weeks of occupation.
lead_paragraph: As Russian troops pulled out of Ukraine’s shuttered Chernobyl nuclear plant five weeks after seizing it, an international nuclear watchdog agency is looking into reports that some of the soldiers are experiencing radiation poisoning.

abstract: What the fight for the Ukrainian port city means for the future of the war.
snippet: What the fight for the Ukrainian port city means for the future of the war.
lead_paragraph: This episode details graphic scenes.

byline.original: By Sabrina Tavernise, Stella Tan, Asthaa Chaturvedi, Luke Vander Ploeg, Rachelle Bonja, Mike Benoist, Patricia Willens, Larissa Anderson, Dan Powell, Elisheba Ittoop, Marion Lozano and Chris Wood

abstract: The ship, a replenishment oiler, is designed to carry fuel to the Navy’s operating carrier strike groups.
snippet: The ship, a replenishment oiler, is designed to carry fuel to the Navy’s operating carrier strike groups.
lead_paragraph: Ruth Bader Ginsburg, the Supreme Court Justice who fought for women’s rights for more than a half century before her death in 2020, will have a U.S. Navy ship named after her, military officials said on Thursday.

abstract: The state will help determine Senate control in this year’s midterm elections.
snippet: The state will help determine Senate control in this year’s midterm elections.
lead_paragraph: Nevada, perhaps more than any other state, has showcased the potential for a more diverse America to move the country’s politics to the left. Rising numbers of Asian American and Latino residents have helped Democrats win the state in the past four presidential elections. The party also holds both of Nevada’s Senate seats.

abstract: A continued run-up in prices shows how rapidly the impact of the war in Ukraine is coursing through Europe’s economy.
snippet: A continued run-up in prices shows how rapidly the impact of the war in Ukraine is coursing through Europe’s economy.
lead_paragraph: PARIS — Soaring energy and food prices driven by Russia’s continued aggression against Ukraine pushed inflation in Europe last month to levels not seen in four decades, with prices in the 19 countries that use the euro soaring 7.5 percent, according to data released Friday by Europe’s statistics agency.

abstract: Edith Kanaka‘ole, who died in 1979, will appear on the coin next year along with four other notable women.
snippet: Edith Kanaka‘ole, who died in 1979, will appear on the coin next year along with four other notable women.
lead_paragraph: George Washington will be sharing some space with a native Hawaiian hula teacher next year.

abstract: Despite strong job growth, all the positions lost during pandemic may not be regained.
snippet: Despite strong job growth, all the positions lost during pandemic may not be regained.
lead_paragraph: This morning, the Labor Department will report how many jobs employers added to their payrolls in March. Economists expect a healthy gain. But how much longer can the labor market keep it up?

byline.original: By Andrew Ross Sorkin, Jason Karaian, Sarah Kessler, Stephen Gandel, Michael J. de la Merced, Lauren Hirsch and Ephrat Livni

abstract: Pope Francis also promised to visit Canada as part of a process of healing and reconciliation over the church’s involvement in an abusive system of residential schools.
snippet: Pope Francis also promised to visit Canada as part of a process of healing and reconciliation over the church’s involvement in an abusive system of residential schools.
lead_paragraph: VATICAN CITY — Pope Francis apologized on Friday for the Roman Catholic Church’s involvement in a system of Canadian boarding schools that abused Indigenous children for 100 years, and said he would travel to Canada as part of a process of healing and reconciliation.

byline.original: By Elisabetta Povoledo and Ian Austen

abstract: The producer of the telecast, Will Packer, said that Smith had been asked to leave after slapping Rock, and that he had urged officials not to “physically remove” the actor.
snippet: The producer of the telecast, Will Packer, said that Smith had been asked to leave after slapping Rock, and that he had urged officials not to “physically remove” the actor.
lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Will Smith, who slapped the comedian Chris Rock at the Oscars, said Friday that he was resigning from the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, saying that he had “betrayed” its trust with conduct that was “shocking, painful, and inexcusable.”

byline.original: By Nicole Sperling and Matt Stevens

abstract: The state is the home of some of the nation’s biggest Ukrainian population centers.
snippet: The state is the home of some of the nation’s biggest Ukrainian population centers.
lead_paragraph: President Biden announced last week that the United States would accept up to 100,000 refugees fleeing the conflict in Ukraine. Many of them, it turns out, may end up in California.

abstract: Coronavirus infections have spread at an elder care facility in Shanghai. Workers said deaths are increasing and resources dwindling.
snippet: Coronavirus infections have spread at an elder care facility in Shanghai. Workers said deaths are increasing and resources dwindling.
lead_paragraph: A coronavirus outbreak is ravaging a hospital in Shanghai for older adults, underscoring the difficulties officials have had in containing infections even as the city imposed a 10-day staggered lockdown.

byline.original: By John Liu, Amy Chang Chien and Paul Mozur

abstract: A tornado that hit a delivery station in Illinois last year will be a focus of the inquiry.
snippet: A tornado that hit a delivery station in Illinois last year will be a focus of the inquiry.
lead_paragraph: The House Committee on Oversight and Reform has opened an investigation into Amazon’s labor practices during severe weather events, according to a letter members sent to Andy Jassy, Amazon’s chief executive.

abstract: A pandemic program allowed people to exclude the benefits from their income, but in some cases they are still being counted. Here’s what to do.
snippet: A pandemic program allowed people to exclude the benefits from their income, but in some cases they are still being counted. Here’s what to do.
lead_paragraph: Unemployment benefits helped millions of people who lost their jobs in the pandemic, but now the payments may throw a wrench into the college financial aid process.

abstract: This cross-cultural crime thriller, which recalls a time when the yakuza ruled Tokyo’s red-light districts and back alleyways, traced a twisty path to TV.
snippet: This cross-cultural crime thriller, which recalls a time when the yakuza ruled Tokyo’s red-light districts and back alleyways, traced a twisty path to TV.
lead_paragraph: TOKYO — These days there are few visible signs of the yakuza in Kabukicho, the storied entertainment and red-light district in the heart of this churning metropolis of more than 37 million people — the biggest city in the world. Aggressive laws have weakened Japan’s organized crime syndicates and chased their aging, declining memberships into the shadows.

abstract: In a major new commission for the Tate museum group in London, the British-Guyanese artist returns to the themes of empire and postcolonial reckoning that have fascinated him throughout his career.
snippet: In a major new commission for the Tate museum group in London, the British-Guyanese artist returns to the themes of empire and postcolonial reckoning that have fascinated him throughout his career.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — On a recent morning, a cavernous studio in south London was a vista of ordered chaos. Elaborate headdresses covered several tables, a jumble of cardboard cutout body parts lay heaped on a palette and boxes overflowed with leopard-print fabrics, fake fur and gaudy fake jewelry. Sewing machines whirred and hammers banged.

abstract: Federal Reserve officials have said the pace of pay gains, if they continue, would not be consistent with stable inflation.
snippet: Federal Reserve officials have said the pace of pay gains, if they continue, would not be consistent with stable inflation.
lead_paragraph: Wages climbed at a rapid pace in the year through March and the unemployment rate dropped notably last month, signs of a hot labor market that could keep pressure on the Federal Reserve as it contemplates how much and how quickly to cool down the economy.

abstract: Every year, hundreds of crossword constructors and fans gather to compete in Stamford, Conn. This year will feature the first live Wordle competition.
snippet: Every year, hundreds of crossword constructors and fans gather to compete in Stamford, Conn. This year will feature the first live Wordle competition.
lead_paragraph: Every year, crossword lovers and solvers come together to participate in the American Crossword Puzzle Tournament.

abstract: Two years into the pandemic, people are coping with big existential problems by making time for simple joys.
snippet: Two years into the pandemic, people are coping with big existential problems by making time for simple joys.
lead_paragraph: These days, whenever Jules Zucker has to run an errand, she throws a Reese’s Fast Break candy bar into her bag.

abstract: The conflict has driven up the cost of food in a region that depends heavily on crops from Russia and Ukraine and is facing what could be its worst drought in four decades.
snippet: The conflict has driven up the cost of food in a region that depends heavily on crops from Russia and Ukraine and is facing what could be its worst drought in four decades.
lead_paragraph: NAIROBI, Kenya — First came the drought, drying up rivers, and claiming the lives of two of Ruqiya Hussein Ahmed’s children as her family fled the barren countryside in southwest Somalia.

abstract: Readers discuss the pros and cons of remote work and more flexible schedules. Also: A mortal Putin; Buffalo Bills’ new stadium; Senator Joe Manchin.
snippet: Readers discuss the pros and cons of remote work and more flexible schedules. Also: A mortal Putin; Buffalo Bills’ new stadium; Senator Joe Manchin.
lead_paragraph: To the Editor:

abstract: The 1950 census reveals its secrets. Also in this edition: how a star of “The O.C.” became a crypto critic, and women call out “medical gaslighting.”
snippet: The 1950 census reveals its secrets. Also in this edition: how a star of “The O.C.” became a crypto critic, and women call out “medical gaslighting.”
lead_paragraph: The 1950 census reveals its secrets. Also in this edition: how a star of “The O.C.” became a crypto critic, and women call out “medical gaslighting.”

abstract: Leisure and hospitality jobs are still far below their pre-Covid levels, but represent a big share of employment gains.
snippet: Leisure and hospitality jobs are still far below their pre-Covid levels, but represent a big share of employment gains.
lead_paragraph: The jobs report released Friday — which showed U.S. employers added 431,000 jobs in March on a seasonally adjusted basis — received a round of applause from many economists and labor market analysts, cooling off fears of a major slowdown in growth. And it spurred hope in the service sector that good times may be back again, and stick around more sustainably.

abstract: The research is thin, but anecdotal experience suggests that the right dose and delivery method can make a positive difference for some people.
snippet: The research is thin, but anecdotal experience suggests that the right dose and delivery method can make a positive difference for some people.
lead_paragraph: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

abstract: Jim Weber, the chief executive of Brooks Running, was a devoted distance runner. Then came cancer.
snippet: Jim Weber, the chief executive of Brooks Running, was a devoted distance runner. Then came cancer.
lead_paragraph: Jim Weber, the longtime chief executive of Brooks Running, was for many years a devoted runner. The hours spent racking up the miles were more than exercise for him. They were a chance to meditate on life, to devise strategy about business, and to ruminate on the thorny problems that come with operating a company with more than $1 billion in annual sales.

abstract: Hear tracks by Angel Olsen, Koffee, Barrie and others.
snippet: Hear tracks by Angel Olsen, Koffee, Barrie and others.
lead_paragraph: Every Friday, pop critics for The New York Times weigh in on the week’s most notable new songs and videos. Just want the music? Listen to the Playlist on Spotify here (or find our profile: nytimes). Like what you hear? Let us know at theplaylist@nytimes.com and sign up for our Louder newsletter, a once-a-week blast of our pop music coverage.

byline.original: By Jon Pareles, Giovanni Russonello and Lindsay Zoladz

abstract: This month’s picks are proof that it doesn’t take big bucks to scare people’s pants off with undead messiahs, unseen demons and uncanny commotions.
snippet: This month’s picks are proof that it doesn’t take big bucks to scare people’s pants off with undead messiahs, unseen demons and uncanny commotions.
lead_paragraph: Kevin (Oghenero Gbaje) and his older sister, Brittney (DeShawn White), arrive with Brittney’s fiancé, Tony (Lenny Thomas), at their parents’ waterside cabin, only to discover that their mother, father and the neighbors have been killed. That’s when they — all three are Black — are accosted by an angry white guy (Nick Damici) with a gun.

abstract: Try our newest recipes for qatayef, caldo de costilla and Italian broccoli salad.
snippet: Try our newest recipes for qatayef, caldo de costilla and Italian broccoli salad.
lead_paragraph: Good morning. Today I am pleased to announce that New York Times Cooking will no longer publish recipes for chicken, duck, turkey, goose, Cornish game hen, pigeon or grouse. This is in keeping with recent reporting that shows that birds aren’t real. They are actually drones used by the government to spy on Americans. They charge on power lines.

abstract: After settling a lawsuit filed during the Trump administration, the Fish and Wildlife Service granted six permits to bring elephant parts into the country. It may approve more in the coming months.
snippet: After settling a lawsuit filed during the Trump administration, the Fish and Wildlife Service granted six permits to bring elephant parts into the country. It may approve more in the coming months.
lead_paragraph: The U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service informed some hunters last month that it would allow the import of six elephant trophies into the United States from Zimbabwe. The African elephant carcasses will be the first allowed into the country in five years.

abstract: An art collector and the institution’s longest-serving board member, she was also a pioneering Black woman in the corporate world.
snippet: An art collector and the institution’s longest-serving board member, she was also a pioneering Black woman in the corporate world.
lead_paragraph: Nancy Lane, a trailblazing corporate executive who promoted the works of Black artists as a champion of the Studio Museum in Harlem for a half-century, died on March 28 at her home in Manhattan. She was 88.

abstract: The mystery of nine hikers who died in Russia has baffled people for more than 60 years. The authors of a recent paper think they’ve found another clue.
snippet: The mystery of nine hikers who died in Russia has baffled people for more than 60 years. The authors of a recent paper think they’ve found another clue.
lead_paragraph: A small avalanche on a desolate Russian mountain, harming no one and quickly erased by the relentless wind, does not usually make news.

abstract: The companies struggled to produce vehicles in the first three months of the year, a sign that shortages could last longer than executives had hoped.
snippet: The companies struggled to produce vehicles in the first three months of the year, a sign that shortages could last longer than executives had hoped.
lead_paragraph: General Motors and Toyota Motor suffered significant drops in car and truck sales in the United States in the first three months of the year as the global shortage of computer chips continued to disrupt production and leave dealers with bare lots.

abstract: His attention-getting first book, “Easy Travel to Other Planets,” began with dolphin-human sex. The three that followed were comparably offbeat.
snippet: His attention-getting first book, “Easy Travel to Other Planets,” began with dolphin-human sex. The three that followed were comparably offbeat.
lead_paragraph: Ted Mooney, who opened his first book, in 1981, with a scene of dolphin-human sex, and who proceeded to write three other offbeat, inventive novels at roughly 10-year intervals, died on March 25 at his home in Manhattan. He was 70.

abstract: Everyone talks about it, no one wants to be in it, and it may not even really exist.
lead_paragraph: Everyone talks about it, no one wants to be in it, and it may not even really exist.

abstract: The week started out with a bang — well, a slap — at the Oscars. The late-night hosts had plenty to say about that and about news revolving around former President Donald Trump.
snippet: The week started out with a bang — well, a slap — at the Oscars. The late-night hosts had plenty to say about that and about news revolving around former President Donald Trump.
lead_paragraph: The week started out with a bang — well, a slap — at the Oscars. The late-night hosts had plenty to say about that and about news revolving around former President Donald Trump.

abstract: Here are the latest results from FIFA’s draw for the 2022 World Cup in Qatar.
snippet: Here are the latest results from FIFA’s draw for the 2022 World Cup in Qatar.
lead_paragraph: Regional and historic rivalries were renewed on Friday as the draw for the 2022 World Cup set out the paths for 32 teams hoping to claim soccer’s biggest championship. The tournament won’t start until November, but for a few teams it might have already been lost: There is only so much luck of the draw to go around, after all.

abstract: Ms. Psaki faced tough questions from the White House press corps about performing her job while negotiating with a news outlet.
snippet: Ms. Psaki faced tough questions from the White House press corps about performing her job while negotiating with a news outlet.
lead_paragraph: Jen Psaki, the White House press secretary, is in advanced talks with MSNBC to join the network after she leaves the Biden administration, according to two people familiar with the negotiations.

byline.original: By John Koblin and Michael M. Grynbaum

abstract: “It’s kind of difficult to be afraid all the time that someone might knock down your door,” one said.
snippet: “It’s kind of difficult to be afraid all the time that someone might knock down your door,” one said.
lead_paragraph: Raising climate awareness under an authoritarian government is lonely and dangerous. But Arshak Makichyan, a young activist from Russia, deeply believed in it.

abstract: The International Energy Agency said member countries had agreed to a release to ease global oil markets rocked by Russia’s war in Ukraine.
snippet: The International Energy Agency said member countries had agreed to a release to ease global oil markets rocked by Russia’s war in Ukraine.
lead_paragraph: The International Energy Agency said Friday that its 31 member nations had agreed to a new release of emergency oil reserves in what is turning into a historic, wide-reaching effort to calm global markets roiled by Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

abstract: Polls and interviews show many Russians now accept the Kremlin’s assertion that their country is under siege from the West. Opponents are leaving the country or keeping quiet.
snippet: Polls and interviews show many Russians now accept the Kremlin’s assertion that their country is under siege from the West. Opponents are leaving the country or keeping quiet.
lead_paragraph: The stream of antiwar letters to a St. Petersburg lawmaker has dried up. Some Russians who had criticized the Kremlin have turned into cheerleaders for the war. Those who publicly oppose it have found the word “traitor” scrawled on their apartment door.

byline.original: By Anton Troianovski, Ivan Nechepurenko and Valeriya Safronova

abstract: Some lucky workers are only working half-Fridays year-round, if they work Fridays at all. The verdict? “It’s magic.”
snippet: Some lucky workers are only working half-Fridays year-round, if they work Fridays at all. The verdict? “It’s magic.”
lead_paragraph: On a warm Friday afternoon in March, around 2 p.m., the West Village in Manhattan was bustling with activity.

abstract: A police chief said that victims’ bodies were discovered in a forest, and showed signs of mutilation.
snippet: A police chief said that victims’ bodies were discovered in a forest, and showed signs of mutilation.
lead_paragraph: The bodies of three men were found in a pit near Bucha, a few miles west of Kyiv, Ukraine’s capital, with signs that the civilians had been “tortured to death” by Russian troops, the regional police chief said on Saturday.

abstract: The war’s worst atrocities have been discovered in this little Ukrainian town not far from the capital of Kyiv.
snippet: The war’s worst atrocities have been discovered in this little Ukrainian town not far from the capital of Kyiv.
lead_paragraph: The war’s worst atrocities have been discovered in this little Ukrainian town not far from the capital of Kyiv.

abstract: Paul Salata made a point of celebrating the last player selected in the draft. His family carried on the tradition by honoring the 262nd pick on Saturday.
snippet: Paul Salata made a point of celebrating the last player selected in the draft. His family carried on the tradition by honoring the 262nd pick on Saturday.
lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS — Only the hardiest of N.F.L. fans stick around to watch the end of the third and final day of the draft. To Paul Salata, it was pure joy.

abstract: The search for elite players is so competitive that IMG, the agency that once ruled tennis, is cultivating preteens to find the next prodigy, giving them access to representatives from the pro tours and Nike.
snippet: The search for elite players is so competitive that IMG, the agency that once ruled tennis, is cultivating preteens to find the next prodigy, giving them access to representatives from the pro tours and Nike.
lead_paragraph: ACHARNES, Greece — Behold Dominik Defoe. Ten years old and barely taller than the net. Golden brown shoulder-length curls bouncing in the air as he chases and crushes tennis balls, which he does better than just about any kid his age.

abstract: The soprano Liudmyla Monastyrska, replacing the Russian superstar Anna Netrebko at the Met in “Turandot,” wrapped herself in a Ukrainian flag for her curtain call.
snippet: The soprano Liudmyla Monastyrska, replacing the Russian superstar Anna Netrebko at the Met in “Turandot,” wrapped herself in a Ukrainian flag for her curtain call.
lead_paragraph: Liudmyla Monastyrska, the Ukrainian soprano, sang the title role in “Turandot” at the Metropolitan Opera on Saturday night in place of the Russian diva Anna Netrebko, whom the company dropped over her past support of President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia.

abstract: Quotation of the Day for Sunday, May 1, 2022.
snippet: Quotation of the Day for Sunday, May 1, 2022.
lead_paragraph: “I don’t think people who originally wrote the laws foresaw a situation where children brought here on visas would be raised and educated here, but not have a clear opportunity to stay and become Americans.”

abstract: Corrections that appeared in print on Sunday, May 1, 2022.
snippet: Corrections that appeared in print on Sunday, May 1, 2022.
lead_paragraph: An article on Page 20 this weekend about the use of natural Black hairstyles in TV and film misstates the given name of one of the stars of “Coming 2 America.” She is Bella Murphy, not Bria Murphy.

abstract: Amid concerns about Covid, President Biden offered some humor and received his own ribbing at the White House Correspondents’ Dinner, a ritual that had gone on hiatus during the pandemic.
snippet: Amid concerns about Covid, President Biden offered some humor and received his own ribbing at the White House Correspondents’ Dinner, a ritual that had gone on hiatus during the pandemic.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The jokes were back, the celebrities were back, the president was back. The only question was whether Covid was back.

abstract: At least three foreigners have been killed fighting with Ukraine’s International Legion. One analyst said many would-be volunteers underestimated the danger from Russian forces.
snippet: At least three foreigners have been killed fighting with Ukraine’s International Legion. One analyst said many would-be volunteers underestimated the danger from Russian forces.
lead_paragraph: The deaths of three foreigners killed this week while fighting with Ukrainian forces has drawn renewed attention to thousands of largely unregulated volunteers who have gone to fight Russia’s invasion, some of them accepted into an international legion.

abstract: Feeling stuck on today’s puzzle? We can help.
snippet: Feeling stuck on today’s puzzle? We can help.
lead_paragraph: SUNDAY — Hi busy bees! Welcome to today’s Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below.

byline.original: By Isaac Aronow and Doug Mennella

abstract: Trading places underground, unexpected sidewalk commentary and more reader tales of New York City in this week’s Metropolitan Diary.
snippet: Trading places underground, unexpected sidewalk commentary and more reader tales of New York City in this week’s Metropolitan Diary.
lead_paragraph: Dear Diary:

abstract: A selection of books published this week.
snippet: A selection of books published this week.
lead_paragraph: THE OXFORD BROTHERHOOD, by Guillermo Martínez, read by P.J. Ochlan. (Blackstone Publishing.) In this brainy thriller, an Oxford grad student in mathematics finds himself embroiled in the shadowy history of Lewis Carroll.

abstract: A blaze that grew significantly over the weekend has residents bracing for more evacuations.
snippet: A blaze that grew significantly over the weekend has residents bracing for more evacuations.
lead_paragraph: SANTA FE, N.M. — High winds in northern New Mexico on Sunday once again posed a stiff challenge to crews battling a large wildfire that grew significantly over the weekend.

abstract: Recent residential sales in New York City and the region.
snippet: Recent residential sales in New York City and the region.
lead_paragraph: Each week, our survey of recent residential sales in New York City and the surrounding region focuses on homes that sold around a certain price point, allowing you to compare single-family homes, condos and co-ops in different locales.

abstract: Wynn Bruce’s death can teach us that climate anxiety and despair can be channeled into constructive action.
snippet: Wynn Bruce’s death can teach us that climate anxiety and despair can be channeled into constructive action.
lead_paragraph: On Earth Day, a 50-year-old man from Boulder, Colo., named Wynn Bruce set himself on fire in front of the Supreme Court. Friends and family members told reporters that they believed his act was a principled protest in the name of the climate crisis.

abstract: After Gerhard Schröder spoke to The Times, he could be kicked out of his party and cut off from some tax-financed perks he enjoys as former chancellor.
snippet: After Gerhard Schröder spoke to The Times, he could be kicked out of his party and cut off from some tax-financed perks he enjoys as former chancellor.
lead_paragraph: The first thing you notice when you walk into the office of Gerhard Schröder is the striking abundance of pictures of Gerhard Schröder.

abstract: A scientist who has studied falling playing cards, coiling rope and other phenomena has now analyzed what transforms a carpenter’s tool into a sonorous instrument.
snippet: A scientist who has studied falling playing cards, coiling rope and other phenomena has now analyzed what transforms a carpenter’s tool into a sonorous instrument.
lead_paragraph: Early in the 19th century, an unknown musician somewhere in the Appalachian Mountains discovered that a steel handsaw, a tool previously used only for cutting wood, could also be used to produce full and sustained musical notes. The idea had undoubtedly occurred to many a musically-inclined carpenter at other times in other places.

abstract: Rarely have so many Americans gained so much equity in so little time, but it’s also inseparable from the housing affordability crisis.
snippet: Rarely have so many Americans gained so much equity in so little time, but it’s also inseparable from the housing affordability crisis.
lead_paragraph: Over the past two years, Americans who own their homes have gained more than $6 trillion in housing wealth. To be clear, that doesn’t mean homebuilders have transferred to buyers $6 trillion worth of new housing, or that existing homeowners have made $6 trillion in kitchen and bathroom upgrades.

byline.original: By Emily Badger and Quoctrung Bui

abstract: After four museums postponed a major exhibition over concerns about Klan imagery in some paintings, the show is opening in Boston. But the debate continues.
snippet: After four museums postponed a major exhibition over concerns about Klan imagery in some paintings, the show is opening in Boston. But the debate continues.
lead_paragraph: BOSTON — In the summer of 2020, looking over a checklist of images and the installation plan for the upcoming Philip Guston show at the National Gallery of Art in Washington, Kaywin Feldman, who was in her second year as the museum’s director, felt uneasy. How would the cartoonish, hooded Ku Klux Klan figures painted by Guston — who explored racism in his enigmatic, politically charged work — look to visitors amid the pain and the push for racial justice that had just exploded after the killing of George Floyd?

byline.original: By Marc Tracy and Robin Pogrebin

abstract: It’s tempting to jump into the home-buying frenzy. But with prices up and mortgage rates surging, make sure you do the math first.
snippet: It’s tempting to jump into the home-buying frenzy. But with prices up and mortgage rates surging, make sure you do the math first.
lead_paragraph: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

abstract: Hospitalizations from Covid-19 are receding, but safety-net providers are facing tremendous unmet needs from poor and uninsured patients who delayed seeking care during the pandemic.
snippet: Hospitalizations from Covid-19 are receding, but safety-net providers are facing tremendous unmet needs from poor and uninsured patients who delayed seeking care during the pandemic.
lead_paragraph: NASHVILLE — Mary Howard, a dishwasher with no health insurance, has never had Covid-19. But the coronavirus, she said, caused her life to spiral over the past two years.

abstract: The man who helped give the world candy-colored computers eventually walked out the door. What does that mean for the company’s next big thing?
snippet: The man who helped give the world candy-colored computers eventually walked out the door. What does that mean for the company’s next big thing?
lead_paragraph: After two years of development, thousands of engineering hours and countless days agonizing over the suppleness of leather and strength of gold for Apple’s bold new product, the company’s design chief, Jony Ive, was thrust into a high-stakes debate over the most primitive concern: a tent.

abstract: As the lockdown of Shanghai and outbreaks in Beijing and elsewhere batter the economy, China’s leader keeps a distance from the politically charged issue.
snippet: As the lockdown of Shanghai and outbreaks in Beijing and elsewhere batter the economy, China’s leader keeps a distance from the politically charged issue.
lead_paragraph: China’s leader, Xi Jinping, waved at crowds of giddily cheering students. He held meetings with Olympic Games officials, economic policymakers and European leaders. He toured a tropical island.

abstract: A new history of the trillion-dollar company in the wake of Steve Jobs.
snippet: A new history of the trillion-dollar company in the wake of Steve Jobs.
lead_paragraph: Between 2001 and 2010, Apple launched the iPod, the iPhone, the MacBook Air and the iPad; each redefined its product category. Of these, the iPhone was the most important. Its obvious superiority forced every other company selling expensive phones to copy Apple’s design or collapse. (Nokia, BlackBerry and Palm were gutted within years.) The Apple of 2010, at the end of its decennium mirabilis, had a record of hardware innovation no other electronics firm could match. Including the Apple of 2020.

abstract: In Michelle Hart’s debut novel, “We Do What We Do in the Dark,” a grieving college student falls for a married woman who happens to be a professor.
snippet: In Michelle Hart’s debut novel, “We Do What We Do in the Dark,” a grieving college student falls for a married woman who happens to be a professor.
lead_paragraph: Is it a uniquely female experience to meet another woman, fall for her brains and beauty and brawn and complications and want to consume her? I’ve never heard men talk about men like this, even ones who date other men, but women seem to know what it’s like to be drawn to another woman so profoundly that you want to fit in her skin, to possess whatever she has that compelled you in the first place. She also fills you with fear.

abstract: Donald Trump’s endorsement of the author and venture capitalist J.D. Vance has shaken up the Republican race for the first major Senate midterm election.
snippet: Donald Trump’s endorsement of the author and venture capitalist J.D. Vance has shaken up the Republican race for the first major Senate midterm election.
lead_paragraph: COLUMBUS, Ohio — Josh Mandel’s wager was simple: No one would outflank him in mirroring Donald J. Trump, either on hard-right America First positions or the bellicose, come-at-me style of the former president.

abstract: From the “Ziwe” premiere, Lincoln Center’s Chaplin Awards and a John Williams concert at Carnegie Hall.
snippet: From the “Ziwe” premiere, Lincoln Center’s Chaplin Awards and a John Williams concert at Carnegie Hall.
lead_paragraph: Whatever phase of the pandemic this is, Covid is still crashing some parties. Cate Blanchett was honored at Film at Lincoln Center’s annual Chaplin Awards on Monday; two of the presenters were no-shows: Todd Haynes, who tested positive that morning, and Bradley Cooper, who said he wasn’t feeling well.

abstract: J.D. Vance is arguably a perfect test case for Mr. Trump: weak enough to need a boost but with enough potential to make him a worthwhile risk.
snippet: J.D. Vance is arguably a perfect test case for Mr. Trump: weak enough to need a boost but with enough potential to make him a worthwhile risk.
lead_paragraph: WEST CHESTER TOWNSHIP, OHIO — It’s a chilly, drizzly evening, but Donald Trump Jr. is putting on a red-hot show at Lori’s Roadhouse, a bar and music joint in a strip mall on the outskirts of Cincinnati. Pretending to be a befuddled, senile President Biden, Don Jr. staggers around the low stage, eyes unfocused, making confused gestures and blundering into the giant red-white-and-blue backdrop.

abstract: Amid the current crisis, Fiona Hill and other former advisers are connecting President Trump’s pressure campaign on Ukraine to Jan. 6. And they’re ready to talk.
snippet: Amid the current crisis, Fiona Hill and other former advisers are connecting President Trump’s pressure campaign on Ukraine to Jan. 6. And they’re ready to talk.
lead_paragraph: Is there a connection between former President Donald J. Trump’s pressure campaign on Ukraine, the Russian invasion and the events of Jan. 6, 2021?

byline.original: By Robert Draper, Jack D'Isidoro, Aaron Esposito, John Woo, Corey Schreppel and Quinton Kamara

abstract: Ron DeSantis and others are desecrating what the G.O.P. long championed.
snippet: Ron DeSantis and others are desecrating what the G.O.P. long championed.
lead_paragraph: In 2010, the Supreme Court held that “political speech does not lose First Amendment protection ‘simply because its source is a corporation.’” The case was Citizens United v. Federal Election Commission, and the conservative justices sided with a group barred by the government from airing a political documentary.

abstract: Officials in China’s capital are striving to contain a coronavirus outbreak while avoiding public anger of the kind that has erupted in Shanghai.
snippet: Officials in China’s capital are striving to contain a coronavirus outbreak while avoiding public anger of the kind that has erupted in Shanghai.
lead_paragraph: With new cases of the coronavirus continuing to accumulate in Beijing, officials over the weekend introduced sweeping new restrictions while stopping short of a full lockdown, a sign of the political and economic challenges that controlling an outbreak in China’s capital poses.

abstract: The U.S. economy shrinks, but still shows it’s still resilient. The Fed meets this week and is expected to approve a larger-than-usual rate increase.
snippet: The U.S. economy shrinks, but still shows it’s still resilient. The Fed meets this week and is expected to approve a larger-than-usual rate increase.
lead_paragraph: Elon Musk reached an agreement on Monday to buy Twitter for about $44 billion, a deal that was unanimously approved by Twitter’s board. The price works out to $54.20 a share, a 38 percent premium over the company’s share price in April, before Mr. Musk revealed he had purchased a 9 percent stake in Twitter. In a matter of weeks, Mr. Musk, the richest person in the world, took his bid from something that investors shrugged off to a serious proposal. The turning point came when he filed documents showing he had the financing to back up his offer. Now, it could be the largest deal to take a company private in at least 20 years, according to data from Dealogic. Still, much remains uncertain as to how the mercurial billionaire will carry out his vision for a platform with less moderation.

abstract: Many Ukrainians are in mobilization mode.
snippet: Many Ukrainians are in mobilization mode.
lead_paragraph: Our colleague Michael Schwirtz has covered Russia’s invasion of Ukraine from its beginning. He has reported from the front on military developments, destruction inside villages and cities in the eastern part of the country and more.

abstract: Look closely at this image, stripped of its caption, and join the moderated conversation about what you and other students see.
snippet: Look closely at this image, stripped of its caption, and join the moderated conversation about what you and other students see.
lead_paragraph: 1. After looking closely at the image above (or at the full-size image), think about these three questions:

abstract: After a secret visit to Kyiv and a three-hour meeting with President Volodymyr Zelensky, Speaker Nancy Pelosi on Sunday pledged broad economic, military and humanitarian support for Ukraine’s government, saying the United States would stand with its ally until Russia was defeated.
lead_paragraph: After a secret visit to Kyiv and a three-hour meeting with President Volodymyr Zelensky, Speaker Nancy Pelosi on Sunday pledged broad economic, military and humanitarian support for Ukraine’s government, saying the United States would stand with its ally until Russia was defeated.

abstract: New York’s baseball teams topped the standings in their respective leagues at the end of the season’s first month for the first time in 36 years.
snippet: New York’s baseball teams topped the standings in their respective leagues at the end of the season’s first month for the first time in 36 years.
lead_paragraph: It is a good year to be a New York baseball team. As a slightly truncated April came to a close on Saturday, the Yankees had the best record in the American League at 15-6 and the Mets were tied with the Milwaukee Brewers for the best record in the National League at 15-7.

abstract: As the election in the Philippines nears, tens of thousands of young people who fear another Marcos presidency are rallying around Leni Robredo, the country’s vice president.
snippet: As the election in the Philippines nears, tens of thousands of young people who fear another Marcos presidency are rallying around Leni Robredo, the country’s vice president.
lead_paragraph: VALENZUELA CITY, Philippines — John Benvir Serag knocked on doors in the working-class neighborhood, wearing his pink “Youth Vote for Leni” T-shirt and holding a stack of fliers. He has spent nearly every day in the past month trying to explain to strangers why Leni Robredo is the best person to lead the Philippines.

abstract: The Ukrainian president said that civilians were being evacuated from the Azovstal steel factory and are headed to a “controlled area.”
snippet: The Ukrainian president said that civilians were being evacuated from the Azovstal steel factory and are headed to a “controlled area.”
lead_paragraph: An evacuation of civilians from Mariupol was underway on Sunday as women and children confined to bunkers beneath a sprawling steel plant started to make their way to safety, according to Ukrainian officials and the United Nations.

abstract: The country’s first female leader, Xiomara Castro, is struggling to advance her feminist agenda 14 years after a coup ended the presidency of her husband, who pursued similar causes.
snippet: The country’s first female leader, Xiomara Castro, is struggling to advance her feminist agenda 14 years after a coup ended the presidency of her husband, who pursued similar causes.
lead_paragraph: She came to power pledging to relax some of the world’s steepest restrictions on women’s reproductive rights. But months into her term, rights groups say, Honduras’s first female president, Xiomara Castro, is struggling to fulfill promises, as attempts to empower women rekindle the country’s bitter ideological divisions.

byline.original: By Anatoly Kurmanaev and Joan Suazo

abstract: Recipes for the end of Ramadan, a busy Wednesday night and everything in between.
snippet: Recipes for the end of Ramadan, a busy Wednesday night and everything in between.
lead_paragraph: Good morning. The days are growing longer, and the joys of weekend life extend along with them. Long-simmered sauces and pot roasts are on the way out. It’s almost the time of the year when a Sunday supper can be held on a stoop, porch or sidewalk folding chair, everyone eating in the falling sun.

abstract: President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi says “The Choice” tells the truth about his rise. Critics say it’s a rewriting of recent history from an industry increasingly cowed under his rule.
snippet: President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi says “The Choice” tells the truth about his rise. Critics say it’s a rewriting of recent history from an industry increasingly cowed under his rule.
lead_paragraph: CAIRO — At the height of the traditional Ramadan TV season, big-budget, star-studded shows captivate millions of Egyptians every night of the holy month with high drama and low comedy. But one episode of the most politically charged show stood out.

abstract: We need to reconnect with material things: nature, soil, our bodies and other people in real life.
snippet: We need to reconnect with material things: nature, soil, our bodies and other people in real life.
lead_paragraph: It rained one morning this week. I moved back to Texas last year, in part for the rainstorms. Here, it rains decisively, gloriously, like it really means it. It explodes, pounds, roars, thunders and then, suddenly, moves on. I stepped on my back porch, not wanting to miss the show.

abstract: Readers respond to Pamela Paul’s first column, about “lived experience.” Also: Those who golf; women’s office clothing.
snippet: Readers respond to Pamela Paul’s first column, about “lived experience.” Also: Those who golf; women’s office clothing.
lead_paragraph: To the Editor:

abstract: President Biden was the first president to attend the White House Correspondents’ Association Dinner since 2016, because his predecessor, Donald J. Trump, boycotted the event.
snippet: President Biden was the first president to attend the White House Correspondents’ Association Dinner since 2016, because his predecessor, Donald J. Trump, boycotted the event.
lead_paragraph: President Biden was the first president to attend the White House Correspondents’ Association Dinner since 2016, because his predecessor, Donald J. Trump, boycotted the event.

abstract: An Army judge is hearing pretrial testimony to determine what evidence can be used at the eventual destroyer Cole death penalty trial.
snippet: An Army judge is hearing pretrial testimony to determine what evidence can be used at the eventual destroyer Cole death penalty trial.
lead_paragraph: GUANTÁNAMO BAY, Cuba — Defense lawyers are delving into the early days of detainee abuse in wartime Afghanistan in pretrial hearings in the destroyer Cole case, with descriptions of a key informant being held hooded and nude, deprived of sleep, used as an ashtray, and made to clean up a fetid spill of human waste and diesel fuel with his bare hands.

abstract: The legend of a pilot who shot down numerous Russian aircraft was one of the more successful pieces of propaganda in Ukraine’s information war.
snippet: The legend of a pilot who shot down numerous Russian aircraft was one of the more successful pieces of propaganda in Ukraine’s information war.
lead_paragraph: He shot down numerous Russian planes, survived enemy attacks and became a symbol of Ukraine’s surprisingly effective air defenses, earning a bold wartime moniker: The Ghost of Kyiv.

abstract: An interesting event to choose to make an entrance.
snippet: An interesting event to choose to make an entrance.
lead_paragraph: The White House Correspondents’ Association Dinner, that much-maligned evening of political and media schmoozing formerly known as the “nerd prom,” returned Saturday night after a two-year Covid-19 hiatus. It may not be the most obvious place for an obsessively followed, newish celebrity couple to make their red carpet debut.

abstract: Hillary Clinton attended a benefit performance of "Suffs," a new musical about the women’s suffrage movement.
snippet: Hillary Clinton attended a benefit performance of "Suffs," a new musical about the women’s suffrage movement.
lead_paragraph: Hillary Clinton attended a benefit performance of "Suffs," a new musical about the women’s suffrage movement.

abstract: Maia Kobabe’s book “Gender Queer,” about coming out as nonbinary, landed the author at the center of a battle over which books belong in schools, and who gets to make that decision.
snippet: Maia Kobabe’s book “Gender Queer,” about coming out as nonbinary, landed the author at the center of a battle over which books belong in schools, and who gets to make that decision.

abstract: Teams that needed quarterbacks did not reach for them, and the receiver market boomed.
snippet: Teams that needed quarterbacks did not reach for them, and the receiver market boomed.
lead_paragraph: Most analysts agreed that the 2022 N.F.L. draft featured the weakest crop of quarterbacks in at least a decade. But few expected quarterback-needy teams to be almost historically unimpressed:

abstract: Taylor beat Serrano in a split decision in the first boxing match headlined by women at Madison Square Garden.
snippet: Taylor beat Serrano in a split decision in the first boxing match headlined by women at Madison Square Garden.
lead_paragraph: Their promoters had billed it as the biggest women’s boxing match in history. By Saturday’s end, surrounded by a deafening, capacity crowd at Madison Square Garden, Katie Taylor and Amanda Serrano had boxing observers immediately suggesting it was the fight of the year — without qualification.

abstract: At least 100 people have died in terrorist attacks over the past two weeks, as the Islamic State targets minorities in Afghanistan and aims to undermine the Taliban government.
snippet: At least 100 people have died in terrorist attacks over the past two weeks, as the Islamic State targets minorities in Afghanistan and aims to undermine the Taliban government.
lead_paragraph: KABUL, Afghanistan — The first blast ripped through a school in Kabul, the Afghan capital, killing high school students. Days later, explosions destroyed two mosques and a minibus in the north of the country. The following week, three more explosions targeted Shiite and Sufi Muslims.

abstract: “I did something I thought was funny, and it wasn’t taken that way,” he said in a television interview on Saturday.
snippet: “I did something I thought was funny, and it wasn’t taken that way,” he said in a television interview on Saturday.
lead_paragraph: The actor Bill Murray said that a movie in which he was set to star was suspended because an attempt at humor had been taken amiss by a female co-star, addressing publicly for the first time an episode that has gotten widespread attention.

abstract: My Twitter pullback is about more than Elon Musk.
snippet: My Twitter pullback is about more than Elon Musk.
lead_paragraph: All journalists have complicated relationships with Twitter. For Black journalists, the relationship is particularly fraught. For Black female journalists, it’s truly treacherous.

abstract: This year’s dance festival pays homage to a Butoh founder, tango’s encounters, the pop group TLC and more.
snippet: This year’s dance festival pays homage to a Butoh founder, tango’s encounters, the pop group TLC and more.
lead_paragraph: To title a work “Not About [Insert Subject] Dance” is a pointed bit of rhetoric. The denial suggests a double taboo: the subject that the work isn’t (but really is) about, and the idea, shunned in certain dance circles, that a dance could be “about” something.

abstract: Credited with opening the first disco, she built an empire of glittering playgrounds for the Beautiful People in Paris, New York and beyond.
snippet: Credited with opening the first disco, she built an empire of glittering playgrounds for the Beautiful People in Paris, New York and beyond.
lead_paragraph: She was born Rachelle Zylberberg in Belgium as the Great Depression struck: a Jewish child abandoned in infancy by her unwed mother and left alone at 12 when her father, a drunken Polish refugee, was arrested by the Nazis in France. She hid in a convent, where she was beaten. After the war, she sold bras in the streets of Paris and vowed to become rich and famous someday.

abstract: Plus Xi remains quiet on Covid lockdowns and young Filipinos rally for a long shot candidate.
snippet: Plus Xi remains quiet on Covid lockdowns and young Filipinos rally for a long shot candidate.
lead_paragraph: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi met with President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine and became the most senior American official to visit its capital, Kyiv, since the start of the war.

abstract: The presence of such a high-ranking official on the front lines is highly unusual and comes amid what Western military analysts describe as increasing disarray within Russian forces.
snippet: The presence of such a high-ranking official on the front lines is highly unusual and comes amid what Western military analysts describe as increasing disarray within Russian forces.
lead_paragraph: ZAPORIZHZHIA, Ukraine — The chief of the general staff of the Russian military, Gen. Valery Gerasimov, the country’s highest ranking uniformed officer, made a visit to dangerous front-line positions in eastern Ukraine late last week in an effort to “change the course” of Russia’s flagging offensive there, according to a senior Ukrainian official. Two U.S. officials with knowledge of the visit also backed that assessment.

byline.original: By Michael Schwirtz and Eric Schmitt

abstract: Confidential polling data obtained by The New York Times underscores the biggest challenges for President Biden and his party as they face the prospect of losing power to Republicans on Capitol Hill.
snippet: Confidential polling data obtained by The New York Times underscores the biggest challenges for President Biden and his party as they face the prospect of losing power to Republicans on Capitol Hill.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Biden enjoyed high approval among Americans in the early months of his presidency. Millions of vaccines were distributed throughout the United States. The White House trumpeted high job growth as proof of a rebounding economy.

byline.original: By Zolan Kanno-Youngs, Jonathan Martin and Alexander Burns

abstract: President Biden paid tribute to Walter F. Mondale, a longtime friend and colleague who preceded him as vice president.
snippet: President Biden paid tribute to Walter F. Mondale, a longtime friend and colleague who preceded him as vice president.
lead_paragraph: President Biden paid tribute to Walter F. Mondale, a longtime friend and colleague who preceded him as vice president.

abstract: Erik Agard returns with a delightful Monday puzzle.
snippet: Erik Agard returns with a delightful Monday puzzle.
lead_paragraph: Programming note: We are happy to announce that, starting May 2, Wordplay will also appear in the print edition of The New York Times on Page A2 on alternating Mondays. This will be the first exposure to the crossword column (and the Crossword) for some readers, so we will be explaining some beginners’ solver concepts and may experiment with the format of the column on those days. We will also include more behind-the-scenes information, so you can look forward to that. Thank you — as always — for reading and for your patience!

abstract: A fight at Dave & Buster’s turned deadly when a man reached for a prize on a high shelf, the police said.
snippet: A fight at Dave & Buster’s turned deadly when a man reached for a prize on a high shelf, the police said.
lead_paragraph: A mishap in the prize area of a Times Square arcade on Saturday night led to a fight between two men that ended when one pulled out a knife and stabbed the other to death, the police said.

byline.original: By Benjamin Weiser, Ashley Southall and Sean Piccoli

abstract: In Mariupol, the scene of intense fighting, civilians who had taken refuge at a steel plant were at least able to begin evacuating.
snippet: In Mariupol, the scene of intense fighting, civilians who had taken refuge at a steel plant were at least able to begin evacuating.
lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — House Speaker Nancy Pelosi traveled to Ukraine’s capital over the weekend, leading the second senior American delegation to meet with President Volodymyr Zelensky in a week and declare support for his country’s fight to beat back the Russian invasion.

byline.original: By Steven Erlanger, Jane Arraf and Marc Santora

abstract: She had a role in the Brink’s heist by the Weather Underground that left two police officers dead. But she became a model prisoner and, after being freed, helped former inmates.
snippet: She had a role in the Brink’s heist by the Weather Underground that left two police officers dead. But she became a model prisoner and, after being freed, helped former inmates.
lead_paragraph: Kathy Boudin, who as a member of the radical Weather Underground of the 1960s and ’70s took part in the murderous 1981 holdup of a Brink’s armored truck and then, in prison and after being freed two decades later, helped inmates struggling to get their lives on track, died on Sunday in New York. She was 78.

snippet: In a world of war and calamity, the European Union needs to pull together even more.
lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — In July 2020, along with European officials and experts, I was asked to take part in a policy game. Convened by a German think tank, we were asked to play out what would happen if either Matteo Salvini or Marine Le Pen, the far-right leaders in Italy and France, came to power. We spent a few hours frenziedly debating how the European Union would respond to each occurrence. Of one thing we were sure: It would be a disaster.

abstract: Lawmakers should make the child tax credit available to families with low or no earnings. There’s a way to do this without adding to inflation.

lead_paragraph: We both served as secretary of the Treasury, and we have been associated with economic policies that are fiscally responsible and invest in our future. It is our strong view that Congress should act this year to ease the financial strain on low-income families raising children and that these policies should be paid for in a package that reduces the deficit. This is not just morally right but is also a critical investment in our nation’s economic future.

lead_paragraph: NOBLEBORO, Maine — We say this with love to our fellow Democrats: Over the past decade, you willfully abandoned rural communities. As the party turned its focus to the cities and suburbs, its outreach became out of touch and impersonal. To rural voters, the message was clear: You don’t matter.

snippet: Eight years after her Y.A. psychological thriller “We Were Liars,” E. Lockhart returns with a prequel, “Family of Liars.”
lead_paragraph: Sometimes a book is a book and sometimes a book is a phenomenon. E. Lockhart’s 2014 Y.A. psychological thriller “We Were Liars” is, without a doubt, a phenomenon.

abstract: Ray Dalio discusses the economic and political mechanics of a changing world order.
snippet: Ray Dalio discusses the economic and political mechanics of a changing world order.
lead_paragraph: The Russia-Ukraine war has opened up questions about America’s role in global affairs and how the balance of power will reshuffle. These questions aren’t new; the discussion of the end of American dominance and the rise of new powers like China has captivated political and economic discourse. It is also the subject of Ray Dalio’s latest book, “Principles for Dealing With the Changing World Order.”

abstract: If red-state legislators truly want to limit abortions — legal and illegal — they must create conditions that give women a genuine choice.
snippet: If red-state legislators truly want to limit abortions — legal and illegal — they must create conditions that give women a genuine choice.
lead_paragraph: NASHVILLE — I’ve been watching anti-abortion bills sweep the red states this season, and it occurs to me that the week of Mother’s Day might be a good time for a red-state mother like me to weigh in. I fervently support a woman’s right to choose, but I still spend a lot of time thinking about how Republican legislators could achieve their real goal without also trying to undo settled legal precedent.

abstract: It may be the most serious prospect of prosecution that Trump and his associates are facing.
snippet: It may be the most serious prospect of prosecution that Trump and his associates are facing.

Trump, offer stunning real-time details of the efforts to overturn the 2020 presidential election. Not least among the revelations are Mr. Meadows’s repeated overtures to the Georgia secretary of state, Brad Raffensperger, with Mr. Meadows pressing the Georgian to be in communication with the White House.

snippet: In Elizabeth Day’s psychological thriller, “Magpie,” an obsessive, boundary-pushing lodger upends the lives of a picture-perfect couple trying to have a baby.
lead_paragraph: “What is she going to do?” wonders Marisa, the nervous, eager-to-conceive woman in “Magpie,” Elizabeth Day’s fourth novel. “In a cheap film — the kind that she watches on cable channels in the afternoons lying on the sofa when she should be working — the wronged woman would pack her bags and leave the house in a fit of righteous indignation.”

Then he lost his balance, and his metal leg, fitted with his old combat boot, hit the ground. Undeterred, he got back up and pushed forward, staring determinedly at his reflection in the mirror.

lead_paragraph: Half an hour before midnight on March 28, the first artillery shell I ever heard screeched above the tiny roof that sheltered my colleagues and me. Our newly formed team had recently arrived in Huliaipole, a small eastern Ukrainian town, to report from the war’s front lines.

snippet: A Brooklyn congregation condemned the desecration of their sacred sanctuary in a burglary that the pastor called “one more blow” to a struggling church.

Six blocks away, St. Augustine’s, the other church where he serves as pastor, was closed and cordoned off with police tape. At its center was a literal and figurative hole.

abstract: Despite some efforts by the largest tech companies to limit the spread of hateful content, it often remains only a click or two away.
snippet: Despite some efforts by the largest tech companies to limit the spread of hateful content, it often remains only a click or two away.

On BitChute, a video sharing site known for hosting right-wing extremism, he listened to a lecture on the decline of the American middle class by a Finnish extremist. On YouTube he found a lurid video of a car driving through Black neighborhoods in Detroit.

snippet: Three vulnerable workers were killed at a nonunion building project, the most at a single construction site since at least 2003. Here is how The New York Times uncovered their stories.
lead_paragraph: Good morning. It’s Wednesday. Today we’ll learn how New York Times journalists investigated a hair-raising tale of three workers killed in an unusual string of construction accidents in the Bronx, and then told it with tenderness. Also, we’ve noticed a run of eyebrow-raising innovations by thieves; we’ll tally some surprising targets and techniques.

lead_paragraph: SOFIA COPPOLA: Forever Young, by Hannah Strong. (Abrams, $45.) In a quarter-century’s worth of movies such as “The Virgin Suicides,” “Lost in Translation” and “Marie Antoinette,” the writer and director has developed a “hyperfeminine aesthetic” as showcased in this visual, critical history, with illustrations by the British magazine Little White Lies.

abstract: For generations, entrepreneurs and dreamers have moved to New York City to strike it big. Now they’re coming to sell a lot of cannabis.
snippet: For generations, entrepreneurs and dreamers have moved to New York City to strike it big. Now they’re coming to sell a lot of cannabis.
lead_paragraph: S. was 30 and C. was 22 when they first met — at a focus group for public transportation in Tampa, Fla., in 2012. The age difference between them was a problem for her at first. “I was like, immediately, ‘No,’” S. says. She had already spent a decade trying to figure out her life. There were years spent working on behalf of tomato-farm laborers in Florida, followed by a stint as a union rep for janitors and security guards at Harvard, in Massachusetts, then jobs as a pastry chef in Boston and in Austin, Texas. By 2016, she was back in Tampa, her hometown, working in kitchens, still making pastries. She was, in C.’s words, “this beautiful, smart woman who’s about this community life.” A few months after the focus group — where, as it happened, they were the only two participants who actually used public transportation — she messaged him on Facebook: “Hey, question, you know anyone I could cop some weed from?”

abstract: Biden’s plans will do little to shore up U.S. leverage.
snippet: Biden’s plans will do little to shore up U.S. leverage.

abstract: How to put up obstacles to young men with dark dreams.
snippet: How to put up obstacles to young men with dark dreams.
lead_paragraph: To fully understand a problem like terrorism, you need to accept complexity, a sprawl of general factors — personal, historical, cultural — converging in a specific movement or a single actor. The kind of mass-murdering, effectively suicidal terrorism that has taken hold in America in the 23 years since Columbine is no different, even if it doesn’t wave a flag or make political demands.

abstract: They’re not everything, but they’re not nothing, either.
snippet: They’re not everything, but they’re not nothing, either.
lead_paragraph: “Partisan polarization remains the dominant, seemingly unalterable condition of American politics,” Pew Research declared in November 2021, a year after a presidential election that drew the most voters in American history (partisanship and polarization, it turns out, increase participation). “Republicans and Democrats agree on very little — and when they do, it often is in the shared belief that they have little in common.”

abstract: And heartbreak and lions and infinite hallways.
