abstract: The leader of the Oath Keepers was convicted of sedition. How did prosecutors make their case and what does the decision reveal?
snippet: The leader of the Oath Keepers was convicted of sedition. How did prosecutors make their case and what does the decision reveal?
lead_paragraph: In a landmark verdict, a jury convicted Stewart Rhodes, leader of the Oath Keepers, a right-wing militia, of sedition for his role in the Jan. 6 assault on the U.S. Capitol.

byline.original: By Michael Barbaro, Nina Feldman, Asthaa Chaturvedi, Eric Krupke, Diana Nguyen, John Ketchum, Mike Benoist, Marion Lozano, Elisheba Ittoop and Chris Wood

abstract: The rising cost of living can look very different depending on where you live.
snippet: The rising cost of living can look very different depending on where you live.
lead_paragraph: Economic policymakers around the world are raising interest rates to try to tame the rising cost of living. Jerome Powell, the Federal Reserve chair, reiterated his commitment to that policy in a speech yesterday. He warned against giving up on inflation “prematurely” and promised to “stay the course until the job is done.”

abstract: This documentary highlights Robert Downey Sr.’s charisma and curiosity even when it shows him in decline.
snippet: This documentary highlights Robert Downey Sr.’s charisma and curiosity even when it shows him in decline.
lead_paragraph: In the films he directed in the late 1960s, Robert Downey Sr. credited himself as “A Prince.” It was a private joke typical of the antic artist. As he told Johnny Carson (he was one of a very few “underground filmmakers” to get booked on “The Tonight Show”), “I’m too young to be a king.”

abstract: A dense espionage narrative proves all too tangled in this directorial debut from the South Korean actor Lee Jung-jae.
snippet: A dense espionage narrative proves all too tangled in this directorial debut from the South Korean actor Lee Jung-jae.
lead_paragraph: “Hunt,” the feature directorial debut of the South Korean actor Lee Jung-jae (a star of “Squid Game”), is a tangled espionage thriller that recalls the suspenseful works of the British novelist John le Carré.

abstract: Since the start of the pandemic, the average U.S. renter is working six hours more each month to cover housing costs.
snippet: Since the start of the pandemic, the average U.S. renter is working six hours more each month to cover housing costs.
lead_paragraph: With skyrocketing rents, landlords aren’t just taking more of your cash — they’re spending more of your time.

abstract: This film about a small-town pastor hoping to mentor his wife’s killer includes one of the final performances from Anne Heche.
snippet: This film about a small-town pastor hoping to mentor his wife’s killer includes one of the final performances from Anne Heche.
lead_paragraph: It’s hard to not watch Anne Heche, who died earlier this year at 53, with a sense of wistfulness in “What Remains,” knowing the role is one of her final ones. The feeling is particularly enhanced by the sense that the actress is both the lone bright spot and somehow the most underutilized presence in a film that struggles to know what it wants to be.

abstract: A measure of inflation that the Federal Reserve watches most closely is showing signs of moderation, though price gains still remain too fast for comfort.
snippet: A measure of inflation that the Federal Reserve watches most closely is showing signs of moderation, though price gains still remain too fast for comfort.
lead_paragraph: Inflation showed welcome signs of slowing in October, but it remained uncomfortably rapid even as a spate of economic data underscored that a return to normal price increases could take time.

abstract: Congress cleared legislation to head off a holiday-season rail strike, after President Biden called for action, warning that a disruption to service could cause dire economic damage.
snippet: Congress cleared legislation to head off a holiday-season rail strike, after President Biden called for action, warning that a disruption to service could cause dire economic damage.
lead_paragraph: Update: President Biden signed the bill into law on Friday.

abstract: Revisiting a graduate thesis that caused controversy in Israel two decades ago, this documentary examines evidence of a possible massacre in 1948.
snippet: Revisiting a graduate thesis that caused controversy in Israel two decades ago, this documentary examines evidence of a possible massacre in 1948.
lead_paragraph: The documentary “Tantura” has already reignited a controversy in Israel. More than 20 years ago, an Israeli graduate student named Teddy Katz submitted a thesis that examined events in the Palestinian village of Tantura in 1948. Drawing on dozens of interviews, he presented evidence suggesting that the Israeli Army had killed scores of Palestinians after capturing the village. In this version of history, Israel wasn’t fighting a war; it was committing a massacre.

abstract: This week’s properties are in Bushwick and on Roosevelt Island and the Upper West Side.
snippet: This week’s properties are in Bushwick and on Roosevelt Island and the Upper West Side.
lead_paragraph: A one-bedroom, one-bath, 766-square-foot apartment with a combined living and dining room that has a painted brick wall, a kitchen with quartz counters and stainless steel appliances, a home office with a built-in desk currently serving as a nursery, a primary bedroom with a door to a fire escape that’s functioning as a balcony, and a washer and dryer, on the second floor of a four-story non-doorman walk-up building near Knickerbocker Avenue. Sarah Riegle, Compass, 917-371-6595; compass.com

abstract: This week’s properties are a four-bedroom in Garden City, N.Y., and a five-bedroom in Norwalk, Conn.
snippet: This week’s properties are a four-bedroom in Garden City, N.Y., and a five-bedroom in Norwalk, Conn.
lead_paragraph: A four-bedroom, three-and-a-half-bath, 2,450-square-foot, three-story house built in 1930, with a slate roof; a front stone patio; a sunken living room with wood ceiling beams and a wood-burning fireplace; a dining room; a family room with skylights and a gas fireplace; basement laundry and storage; a stone patio, and a one-car garage, on 0.19 acres. Lisa Heaney, Daniel Gale Sotheby’s International Realty, 516-376-3470; danielgale.com

byline.original: By Claudia Gryvatz Copquin and Alicia Napierkowski

abstract: If you know where to look.
snippet: If you know where to look.
lead_paragraph: SANTA MARIA — Driving from Los Angeles to the Central Coast over the weekend, I spotted the most Californian of autumnal scenes: vineyards showing off their fall colors.

abstract: Tommy Wirkola’s film tries to pass off sadism as comedy.
snippet: Tommy Wirkola’s film tries to pass off sadism as comedy.
lead_paragraph: There is truth in advertising: “Violent Night” is set on Christmas and it’s gore-in-Santa’s-beard brutal.

abstract: Consumption climbed and personal income rose, even after accounting for inflation, new data from the Commerce Department showed.
snippet: Consumption climbed and personal income rose, even after accounting for inflation, new data from the Commerce Department showed.
lead_paragraph: Americans continued spending in October, with personal consumption expenditures picking up even after adjusting for inflation, new data released Thursday showed.

abstract: One of the six packages containing “pyrotechnic material” was also sent to the prime minister’s office in Madrid, prompting the authorities to increase security.
snippet: One of the six packages containing “pyrotechnic material” was also sent to the prime minister’s office in Madrid, prompting the authorities to increase security.
lead_paragraph: MADRID — Officials in Spain have increased security measures at consulates and public administrative buildings in the country after at least six letter bombs were mailed to several offices, including those of Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez and the American and Ukrainian Embassies.

byline.original: By José Bautista, Isabella Kwai and John Ismay

abstract: In closing statements, the defense and prosecution pushed opposing views about the actions of the former chief financial officer, Allen H. Weisselberg.
snippet: In closing statements, the defense and prosecution pushed opposing views about the actions of the former chief financial officer, Allen H. Weisselberg.
lead_paragraph: [The jury has reached a verdict in the trial of the Trump Organization. Follow for the latest.]

abstract: Jim Parsons and Ben Aldridge star in this tear-jerker romance adapted from the memoir by the television journalist Michael Ausiello.
snippet: Jim Parsons and Ben Aldridge star in this tear-jerker romance adapted from the memoir by the television journalist Michael Ausiello.
lead_paragraph: The awkward weepie “Spoiler Alert” charts the rocky romance of the Manhattanites Michael (Jim Parsons) and Kit (Ben Aldridge) from meet-cute to cancer. Its director, Michael Showalter (of the coma comedy “The Big Sick”), is becoming a medical specialist. Jean-Luc Godard needed a girl and a gun; Showalter prefers a couple, their in-laws and a hospital bed.

abstract: Prince William and Catherine, Princess of Wales, arrived in Boston in a snap of cold rain and on the tails of another crisis for the palace.
snippet: Prince William and Catherine, Princess of Wales, arrived in Boston in a snap of cold rain and on the tails of another crisis for the palace.
lead_paragraph: BOSTON — In its spirit, the arrival of Prince William and Catherine, Princess of Wales, to Boston on Tuesday landed somewhere between Kabuki and comic operetta.

abstract: Ramin Bahrani’s first documentary feature profiles Richard Davis, the irrepressible inventor of a modern bulletproof vest.
snippet: Ramin Bahrani’s first documentary feature profiles Richard Davis, the irrepressible inventor of a modern bulletproof vest.
lead_paragraph: In “2nd Chance” the director, Ramin Bahrani, introduces Richard Davis as the only man to have shot himself 192 times. The number is impressive and also excessive, which is one way of describing Davis, the jolly inventor of a modern bulletproof vest and a born salesman. Shooting himself repeatedly on tape, he wanted to demonstrate the effectiveness of his vests, but what he was also doing was building a gonzo reputation too catchy to ignore or resist.

abstract: The 30-year-old crypto entrepreneur made his first public appearance since the collapse of his firm, FTX, last month.
snippet: The 30-year-old crypto entrepreneur made his first public appearance since the collapse of his firm, FTX, last month.
lead_paragraph: The New York Times’s DealBook newsletter held its annual conference in New York on Wednesday, capped by a dramatic interview with Sam Bankman-Fried, the fallen crypto mogul.

abstract: The police said the boy, Prince Shabazz, was found Wednesday night outside a building in Fordham Heights with a gunshot wound to his torso.
snippet: The police said the boy, Prince Shabazz, was found Wednesday night outside a building in Fordham Heights with a gunshot wound to his torso.
lead_paragraph: A 14-year-old boy was fatally shot outside an apartment building in the Fordham Heights section of the Bronx on Wednesday night, the police said.

abstract: As long as we do the best we can, and appreciate life’s fullness, we will leave the world a better place for our children.
snippet: As long as we do the best we can, and appreciate life’s fullness, we will leave the world a better place for our children.
lead_paragraph: This personal reflection is part of a series called Turning Points, in which writers explore what critical moments from this year might mean for the year ahead. You can read more by visiting the Turning Points series page.

byline.original: By Esther Duflo and Abhijit Banerjee

abstract: There are fewer films now that allow an actor to grow a persona and a Tom Cruise level of stardom. It’s a crisis, and the movies know it.
snippet: There are fewer films now that allow an actor to grow a persona and a Tom Cruise level of stardom. It’s a crisis, and the movies know it.
lead_paragraph: Obviously, two of the year’s biggest movies are just the second installments of franchises that could go on long after we’re gone. One of them is actually calling itself “Wakanda Forever.” But I’m watching us devour both it and “Top Gun: Maverick” and see a referendum on a more pressing matter: stars and the movies’ disuse for them.

abstract: Several cities announced the easing of lockdown regulations and testing requirements after the country’s biggest demonstrations in decades.
snippet: Several cities announced the easing of lockdown regulations and testing requirements after the country’s biggest demonstrations in decades.
lead_paragraph: In the southern Chinese city of Guangzhou, residents returned to work on Thursday for the first time in weeks after Covid-19 lockdowns were lifted. In Chongqing, in the southwest, some residents were no longer required to take regular Covid tests. And in Beijing, a senior health official played down the severity of current Omicron variants, a rare move for the government.

byline.original: By David Pierson and Chang Che

abstract: The largest newspaper chain is cutting roughly 6 percent of its 3,440-person U.S. media division.
snippet: The largest newspaper chain is cutting roughly 6 percent of its 3,440-person U.S. media division.
lead_paragraph: Gannett, the largest newspaper chain in the United States, began another round of layoffs Thursday, joining a host of other media companies cutting jobs in recent weeks.

abstract: I'm a senior staff editor on the Culture desk. Here are five things I've been entertaining myself with.
snippet: I'm a senior staff editor on the Culture desk. Here are five things I've been entertaining myself with.
lead_paragraph: I'm a senior staff editor on the Culture desk. Here are five things I've been entertaining myself with.

abstract: Frappart, a 38-year-old French referee, has more experience on the men’s stage than any other woman.
snippet: Frappart, a 38-year-old French referee, has more experience on the men’s stage than any other woman.
lead_paragraph: Some 92 years after the first World Cup game was held in Uruguay, Stéphanie Frappart became the first woman to be the lead referee during a men’s match at the tournament. Frappart, a French referee, led a refereeing crew of all women during a decisive group stage game between Costa Rica and Germany on Thursday, which Germany won, 4-2.

abstract: Luke Evans, Olivia Colman and Jessie Buckley lend their voices to this animated musical of the holiday classic.
snippet: Luke Evans, Olivia Colman and Jessie Buckley lend their voices to this animated musical of the holiday classic.
lead_paragraph: In a season of movies that singe the rich — we see you “The Menu” and “Glass Onion: A Knives Out Mystery” — the animated musical “Scrooge: A Christmas Carol” spares one of literature’s more infamous capitalists, Mr. Ebenezer Scrooge (voiced by Luke Evans). Perhaps “spares” is not the right word for what Jacob Marley’s partner in predatory lending endures in the director Stephen Donnelly’s vivid if hardly warranted adaptation of Charles Dickens’s 1843 novella.

abstract: The trial comes after years of scrutiny of the Trump Organization and Donald J. Trump himself. It is among the largest legal challenges faced by the man and the business.
snippet: The trial comes after years of scrutiny of the Trump Organization and Donald J. Trump himself. It is among the largest legal challenges faced by the man and the business.
lead_paragraph: [The jury has reached a verdict in the trial of the Trump Organization. Follow for the latest.]

abstract: Names and other identifying details of more than 6,000 asylum seekers were accidentally published on the ICE website for a few hours, the agency said. Advocates now fear for their safety.
snippet: Names and other identifying details of more than 6,000 asylum seekers were accidentally published on the ICE website for a few hours, the agency said. Advocates now fear for their safety.
lead_paragraph: Immigration and Customs Enforcement mistakenly released the names and other identifying details of 6,252 migrants seeking protection in the United States this week, the agency said Wednesday. The error raised fears for their safety among advocates for asylum seekers.

byline.original: By Livia Albeck-Ripka and Miriam Jordan
